column4: Making it harder to get prescriptions is not going to help this issue at all.
So not only can I expect a short life.  I can also expect it to be fucking PAINFUL!!
Why include overdose deaths in average life expectancy?

um do you know how average life expectancy works dude ?...

it takes all deaths in a country as well as the cause and then the mean is calculated.
Yea of course, but we shouldn't include OD's in the average life expectancy because the average person doesn't shoot dope.

People who get diabetes due to poor diet and then die because of that disease are counted. . . If that's the case then why shouldnt  deaths from addiction/overdoses count 


  and again all deaths are counted in the average. . . All this is pointing out is how many people are dying from ODs and that its actually causing the US life expectancy to drop . . . In order for that to happen it shows the scale of the issue


U could say the same thing regarding getting and dying from diabetes, regarding your "average" person  comment. .most do not acquire diabetes but alot do. .  . And the fact is many people are dying from overdoses


Again just posted it because I found it interesting. . . But all deaths should be counted imo
so if someone dies of a drug overdose then what should the cause of death be attributed to ?
